    Research

    At CMU, I was fortunately advised by Professor Louis-Philippe Morency and Paul Liang. I was also a core member of MultiComp Lab.

    Quantifying & Modeling Feature Interactions: An Information Decomposition Framework
    Paul Pu Liang, Yun Cheng, Xiang Fan, Chun Kai Ling, Suzanne Nie, Richard Chen, Zihao Deng, Faisal Mahmood, Ruslan Salakhutdinov, Louis-Philippe Morency
    NeurIPS 2023
    Multimodal Learning Without Labeled Multimodal Data: Guarantees and Applications
    Paul Pu Liang, Chun Kai Ling, Yun Cheng, Alexander Obolenskiy, Yudong Liu, Rohan Pandey, Alex Wilf, Louis-Philippe Morency, Ruslan Salakhutdinov
    Submitted
    Multimodal Fusion Interactions: A Study of Human and Automatic Quantification
    Paul Pu Liang, Yun Cheng, Ruslan Salakhutdinov, Louis-Philippe Morency
    ACM ICMI 2023
    MultiZoo & MultiBench: A Standardized Toolkit for Multimodal Representation Learning
    Paul Pu Liang, Yiwei Lyu, Xiang Fan, Arav Agarwal, Yun Cheng, Louis-Philippe Morency, Ruslan Salakhutdinov
    JMLR Open Source Software 2022
    MultiBench: Multiscale Benchmarks for Multimodal Representation Learning
    Paul Pu Liang, Yiwei Lyu, Xiang Fan, Zetian Wu, Yun Cheng, Jason Wu, Leslie Chen, Peter Wu, Michelle A. Lee, Yuke Zhu, Ruslan Salakhutdinov, Louis-Philippe Morency
    NeurIPS 2021

    During my undergraduate study, I was fortunate to work with Professor Tomasz Tkocz in the 2020 SEMS program offered by CMU Department of Mathematical Sciences. The summer project was extended to a paper submitted to Electron. J. Combin.

    Typical Values of Extremal-Weight Combinatorial Structures with Independent Symmetric Weights
    Yun Cheng, Yixue Liu, Tomasz Tkocz, Albert Xu
    Electron. J. Combin.
    [SEMS presentation]
